title: Poster, "Color, an Exhibition of Original Work for  the American Institute of Graphic Arts", 1974
title_raw: Color, an Exhibition of Original Work for  the American Institute of Graphic Arts
medium: Offset lithogaphy on white wove paper
signed: In pencil center left belor image: Fred Troller, 1974; and imprinted:  Artist:Imprinted center left below image Fred Troller
inscribed: Imprinted lower left in black: Kimberly-Clark Lithofect Gloss, 100lbs.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Poster design consists of a photographic reproduction of one of Ferd Troller's paintings on a white sheet with dark grayt text below. The painting consists of vivid blue, green and purple curved and circular shapes that seem to float on a saturated red ground.  A penciled signature is visible on the image lower left.. With a center justification below the text: COLOR / an exhibition of original work / of distinguished artists, designers and photographers / from the United Statesand abroad / sponsored by / The American Institute of Graphic Arts.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Color, an Exhibition of Original Work for  the American Institute of Graphic Arts", 1974. Offset lithogaphy on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-220.
